optionalfeature.name: Onigiri Beam
entries: If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with Eldritch Blast you gain a {@item Spirit Biscuit|YokaiPatron}. This is an item weighing 1/2 pound. As a bonus action, it can be consumed or fed to a creature. That creature then gains {@dice 3d4+3} hit points. At 10th level, this increases to 5d4+5 hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Yokai Reserve
entries: Once per long rest, as an action you can tap into extra magic reserves and regain a Warlock spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Spiritual Bond
entries: When you use the Summon Guardian Spirit feature it's unarmed attack now deals 2d8 + 4 magic bludgeoning damage.
In addition, once per day the Guardian Spirit may take the multi-attack Action twice.
Once per day, when the Guardian Spirit reaches 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to spend a Warlock spell slot and restore it to full health.

subclassFeature.name: The Yokai
entries: You have forged a pact with a yokai spirit. These wandering spirits commonly take the form of animals, humanoids or sometimes a combination of the two. Regardless of their chosen guise they will very rarely show anyone their true form and will generally do their utmost to hide it. The nature of a yokai will usually depend on it's conception and can vary from malevolent, mischievous to friendly.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Yokai lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Soothing Whispers
entries: Starting at 1st level, the Yokai's voice whispers to you, soothing your nerves. You gain advantage on all checks to resist being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened} and to maintain concentration on a spell.

subclassFeature.name: Yokai Balance
entries: At 6th level you begin to learn to balance the negative and positve sides of the spirits. You may use a bonus action to distract a creature who can see or hear you. You gain advantage on your next attack against this creature and the creatures next attack against you is made with disadvantage. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Ward
entries: At 10th level your patron's magic wards you against death. Once per day you gain the benefit of the {@spell Death Ward} spell.

When the ward is triggered you can use your reaction to make a ranged spell attack using your spell attack modifier to fire a beam of vengeful energy at an enemy within 120ft of you, doing {@damage 2d10+5} force damage on a hit. If the attack hits you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d10} plus your warlock level, the temporary hit points increase with 1d10 at leve1 17.

subclassFeature.name: Summon Guardian Spirit
entries: At 14th level, you have earned enough of the yokai's favor that you may use an action and expend a spell slot to summon a {@creature Guardian Spirit|YokaiPatron}. The guardian appears in an unoccupied space within 60 ft. of you. It has it's own initiative and it's own turns. On your turn, you may issue a command to the guardian (no action required) telling it what to do on it's next turn. If it has no command, it will attack any creature in reach which has attacked it or you. The guardian will persist for up to an hour. Once used, this feature may not be used again until after you complete a long rest.

trait.name: Vigilant Guardian.
entries: The guardian has advantage on all initiative rolls, and advantage on all Perception checks.

trait.name: Life Transfer.
entries: Whenever the guardian reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, it gains 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. If it is at maximum hit points, it instead gains 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) temporary hit points.

trait.name: Howl.
entries: The guardian has disadvantage on all saving throws against becoming Frightened. If it fails a saving throw, instead of becoming Frightened, all creatures within 10 ft. of the guardian must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 12 ({@damage 3d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half that on a succesful one. The guardian then has disadvantage on all attacks which are not targeting the creature which caused the saving throw until the end of it's next turn.

trait.name: Daemonblade.
entries: The guardian's melee weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with a melee weapon, it doubles it's ability score modifier for determining damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: The guardian makes two Daemonblade attacks or one Twin-Bolted Crossbow attack.

action.name: Daemonblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Twin-Bolted Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/90 ft., up to two target within 5 ft of each other. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Unarmed attack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Ferocious Warrior.
entries: Whenever the guardian deals damage with a melee weapon attack, it may use a bonus action to make an unarmed attack against the same creature ({@hit 8} to hit, 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage on a hit).

item.name: Spirit Biscuit
entries: If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with Eldritch Blast you gain a spirit biscuit. This is an item weighing 1/2 pound. As a bonus action, it can be consumed or fed to a creature. That creature then gains 3d4+3 hit points.
At 10th level, this increases to 5d4+5 hit points.
